items.name: This place… everything feels like it’s repeating.
Because it is. We’ve entered a time loop.
Because it had been floating long before we arrived.
So this is where we use Past Perfect Continuous?
Yes. When something was happening for a while before another past moment.
Like: I had been walking for hours before I found the exit.
Perfect. It shows the duration of an earlier action.
She had been crying since the bells rang.
Or: He had been sitting here until the echoes stopped.
Which sentence uses Past Perfect Continuous?

translates.name: Какое предложение в Past Perfect Continuous?

actions.name: He had been waiting for hours before the door opened.
He waits for hours before the door opens.

items.name: Write a sentence using: had been, sitting, for

translates.name: Составь предложение с had been, sitting, for

actions.name: She had been sitting for a long time before he arrived.
She sits for a long time before he arrive.

items.name: I get it now. We show how long something was happening before.
And that’s how you step out of the loop.
